title: Italy is going on strike tomorrow – how will it affect travellers?
text:
The holiday plans of thousands of travellers visiting Italy this weekend could be left in tatters with a national strike disrupting flights and bringing public transport across the country to a standstill.

EasyJet has already cancelled 32 flights, affecting more than 5,000 passengers, and warned those still due to fly to leave extra time for their journey.

The “Black Friday” industrial action will start late on Thursday night and impact rail, ferry and airport services across Italy, including in key cities such as Rome, Florence, Naples and Milan.

The 24-hour walkout has been called by trade unions protesting over pay and working conditions. In Rome, a general strike will include both public and private sector employees.
